results.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1004) to amend chapter 3 of title 5, United States Code, to require the publication of information relating to pending agency regulatory actions, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1009) to amend title 44, United States Code, to require the Administrator of the Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs to review regulations, and for other purposes.

results.latest_major_action: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
results.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1004) to amend chapter 3 of title 5, United States Code, to require the publication of information relating to pending agency regulatory actions, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1009) to amend title 44, United States Code, to require the Administrator of the Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs to review regulations.
results.summary_short: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1004) to amend chapter 3 of title 5, United States Code, to require the publication of information relating to pending agency regulatory actions, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1009) to amend title 44, United States Code, to require the Administrator of the Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs to review regulations.

actions.description: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 234 - 180 (Roll no. 116). (text: CR 1403-1404)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 233 - 189 (Roll no. 115). (consideration: CR H1408, H1419-1420)
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H1419-1421)

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H.Res. 156, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Polis demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on ordering the previous question until later in the legislative day.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 156.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H1403-1408)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 14.
Providing for consideration of H.R. 1004 and H.R. 1009.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 115-21, by Mr. Sessions.
